humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the size of the largest tumor, which measures 6.0 cm in greatest dimension. Using the rules provided, a T3 tumor is defined as being more than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage for this patient's cancer is T3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage of a cancer is determined by the size of the primary tumor. In this report, the primary tumor in the right breast measures 6.0 cm in greatest dimension (gross). This measurement puts the tumor in the T3 category, as T1 is up to 2 cm, T2 is 2-5 cm, and T3 is more than 5 cm. Therefore, the T stage from this report is T3.
